H0.text: Competition is the type of relationship that exists between trees and kudzu growing on them, where the kudzu vines climb and wrap around the trees, starving them of sunlight and potentially causing the trees to die.

H1.text: Mutualism is the type of relationship that exists between the trees and the kudzu growing on them, where the vines climb and wrap around the trees, causing the trees to be starved of sunlight.

H2.text: Parasitism is the type of relationship that exists between trees and kudzu vines, because the vines climb and wrap around the trees, starve them of sunlight, and can cause the trees to die.

H3.text: Predator-prey is the type of relationship that exists between trees and kudzu growing on them, where the kudzu vines climb and wrap around the trees, starving them of sunlight and potentially causing their death.

A5.text: Since holoparasites have no chlorophyll and therefore cannot make food for themselves by photosynthesis, they are always obligate parasites, deriving all their food from their hosts.
